title: Château la Coste 2017 Grand Vin Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This old-vine wine is an unusually rich style of rosé, soft, creamy-textured and generously fruity. The acidity is there although without crispness, so that the wine has intensity, caramel flavors and a touch of pepper at the end. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château Pas du Cerf 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is a pale-colored rosé, rounded with spice and caramel as well as crisp, clean acidity. Red-currant and raspberry fruitiness gives the wine a deliciously fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Terres Douces 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This is a crisp, fruity wine with lively acidity. Its bright texture and lemon and grapefruit purity are delicious and ready to drink.

title: Clos Alivu 2017 Vermentino (Patrimonio)
description: This balanced, creamy and fruity wine from 50-year-old vines is still young but already delicious. It's succulent and juicy, with apple flavors and zesty acidity at the end. Drink from late 2018.

title: Columbia Winery 2015 Vision Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Aromas of plum, raspberry jam, white pepper and barrel spice lead to full-bodied fruit flavors. Raspberry and plum notes linger on the slightly candied finish.

title: Comartin 2017 Adelaide's Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Strawberry punch aromas meet with cotton candy on the light but very inviting and rounded nose of this Grenache-based pink wine. It's soft on the palate with just enough grip to make for a compelling sip.

title: Day Owl 2017 Rosé (California)
description: This is a ripe and relatively full-flavored wine made from Barbera that offers somewhat richer fruit flavors than many of its peers and a lush mouthfeel. The peach and apple flavors are vivid, and good acidity keeps it lively on the palate.

title: Domaine de Cala 2017 Classic Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This pale-colored wine is light, crisp and zestily refreshing. It has a fresh, bright character that is full of red-currant and spice flavors. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Domaine de Cala 2017 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: A refreshing fruity blend of Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah with a touch of white Rolle, this wine is bright, offering intense acidity as well as a sweep of red fruits. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2017 VieVité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The fruit and the good acidity are balanced by the ripe nature of this wine. It has concentration, with red-currant and berry flavors all attractively packaged. Drink this wine now.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Small amounts of Sauvignon Musque and Sauvignon Gris are blended within this substantive, lushly built wine, which is thick and rich in flavors of peach and vanilla. The finish brightens with aromas of jasmine.

title: Dürnberg 2017 Falko Cool Climate White (Niederösterreich)
description: Orange zest and fresh apples make for a most appetizing and fragrant nose. The palate is just as vivid, fruit-forward and fresh. This may be easy and totally driven by fruit but is carries bags of charm despite its lightness. It's the quintessential party wine.

title: Fattoria il Palagio 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano
description: Acacia, Spanish broom, apricot and toasted nut aromas set the tone in this wine. Mirroring the nose, the rounded palate offers ripe peach, yellow apple, orange zest and honey hints while an almond note gives it a pleasantly bitter close.

title: Fattoria San Donato 2015 Benedetta Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting oak, paraffin and thyme. The palate is more expressive, offering dried apricot, citrus zest, grilled herb and bitter almond flavors.

title: Felsner 2017 Hesperia Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: Confected notes of pear drop and strawberry create a very open appetizing nose. The palate has a little spritz to keep things fresh on the zippy easy fruit-driven palate. With its light dry appeal, this is all about easy summer afternoons. Drink soon.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Saint Vincent Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: A hint of bramble lends complexity to this wine's understated raspberry and wild strawberry aromas. It's a zesty, mouthwatering dry rosé boasting tart red fruit flavors and a crystalline, mineral finish.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Titolato Strozzi  (Chianti Colli Senesi)
description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with iris, underbrush and Mediterranean herb aromas. The youthful, easygoing palate offers raspberry, white pepper and clove hints alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Il Colombaio 2016 Contessa Ava  (Chianti)
description: This wine's underbrush, tilled soil and dark fruit aromas appear in the glass. The straightforward palate offers black plum, clove and white pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Lamadrid 2013 Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)
description: An opaque dark-purple color and thick raisiny aromas announce a wine at maximum ripeness and saturation. On the palate, this is syrupy, with only moderate acidity. Toasty, oaky prune and blackberry flavors are peppery prior to a warm, dense finish.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Reserve Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Loads of citrus and banana cream pie make for a mouthwatering bouquet. The palate is softly structured and ripe in feel, with ripe tropical fruit flavors balanced by lightly charred citrus.

title: Landhaus Mayer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: A whiff of passion fruit flickers across the mind before ripe pear takes over. The very light palate is equally fruit driven with a gentle, ripe freshness across the very light dry palate.

title: Lasorda Family WInes 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Los Angeles Dodgers longtime manager Tommy Lasorda's family is making wine now, starting with this bottling that's loaded with aromas of Asian pear, salted lemon, peach blossom and custard on the nose. The palate is rounded with flavors of creamed pear and then cut with brisk lemony acidity.

title: Le Querce 2013 Red (Toscana)
description: Made from 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this opens with toasted oak, espresso and dark fruit aromas. The dense palate offers vanilla, mocha, tobacco and black cherry jam notes alongside close-grained tannins.

title: Le Querce 2014 La Torretta  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)
description: This wine's cedar, tobacco and plum aromas appear in the glass. On the palate, rounded tannins support Morello cherry, vanilla and orange peel touches. Drink through 2021.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Concord grape, boysenberry and dried anise aromas show on the nose of this fresh bottling. The palate focuses first on dried herbs and then moves into elderberry as well as elderflower, beef jerky and soy.

title: Les Domaines Auriol 2014 Domaine Hauts Garrigues Red (Côtes du Rhône Villages)
description: Made from organic grapes, this is a juicy, approachable wine full of forward black plum and cherry flavors. Full bodied in style, it's accented by hints of caramelized sugar, nut and granite. The moderately long finish is marked by fine-grained, soft tannins.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2017 Fleur de Mer Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Lightly herbal and crisp, this is a delicious, fragrant wine. It has a typical light Provencal color along with great fruitiness and a ripe red-fruit aftertaste. Drink now.
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Cuvée G Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: Stalky and packed with black-currant and berry fruits, this wine is intense with tannins, acidity and a licorice flavor. All this will soften to give a rich wine, although likely the stalky fruit will likely remain. Drink from 2020.

title: Loimer 2017 Lois Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Notes of juicy green pear characterize the nose. The palate is less defined when it comes to fruit but is easy, fluid, fresh and very light. This is almost translucent in flavor and has a dry finish.

title: Loscano 2015 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Plump berry aromas are easygoing. In the mouth, this is more raw and acidic, leading to punchy plum, berry and cassis flavors. A fresh finish thins out quickly, leaving grating edginess.
